title: LDS Author Stays True to Family Values in Swiss Family Robinson Sequel

SEATTLE , Oct. 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Based on the original 1812 Swiss Family Robinson novel, "Return to Robinson Island " picks up where Johann David Wyss left off with the first sequel in over one hundred years. In alignment with Johann Wyss's desire to instill values to his children, bestselling author TJ Hoisington stays true to the principled living the Robinsons aspired to. As the Robinsons live by their abiding faith they find peace amidst dangerous circumstances.

NOW AVAILABLE WHEREVER BOOKS ARE SOLD.
Synopsis:
"Return to Robinson Island " begins 15 years after the Robinson family became shipwrecked on a remote island in the East Indies. The Robinsons originally left their homeland, desiring to own land and worship in peace according to their conscience. Fast forward to the year 1815, Ernest Robinson is now 27 years old, and a 1st Lieutenant in the British Royal Navy. When Ernest's commanding officer, Captain Charlie, is court-martialed for war crimes, Ernest is forced to tell the truth even if his testimony sends his former Captain to prison. Meanwhile, a vast trove of treasure is found on the island, and the Robinsons soon find themselves in mortal danger when Captain Charlie vows to make the treasure his own. The Robinsons rely on their survival skills as they depend on God to deliver them.
What ensures is a page-turning, action-packed adventure in which the Robinson Family must use survival skills and guerrilla tactics to safeguard their lives and island home. Weaved throughout the adventure story, is a thread of romance that becomes threatened by the betrayal of a family friend. The Robinsons know they will be required to use their knowledge of the island and ingenuity like never before. Will the Robinson Family survive this attack?
TJ HOISINGTON IS AVAILABLE FOR INTERVIEWS.
About the Author:
"Return to Robinson Island " is TJ Hoisington's first work of fiction. TJ Hoisington is the author of the international bestseller, "If You Think, You Can!: Thirteen Laws that Govern the Performance of High Achievers." TJ is also the author of "If You Think You Can for Teens" and "The Secret of the Slight Edge." TJ Hoisington is a motivational speaker and organizational performance consultant.
